subject: Re: [PATCHv6 06/17] LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size

reviews.author: Kiryl Shutsemau (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Kiryl Shutsemau, raised no specific technical concerns regarding the patch 'LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size'.

reviews.author: Muchun Song
reviews.summary: Muchun Song reviewed patches related to the vmemmap optimization, specifically LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size, and gave Acked-by for several patches.

reviews.author: David (arm)
reviews.summary: Reviewer David raised concerns about potential issues with HugeTLB vmemmap optimization (HVO) for architectures where sizeof(struct page) is not a power of 2, specifically pointing out that the metadata must span at least two pages.

reviews.author: Usama Arif
reviews.summary: Reviewer Usama Arif raised concerns about the patch for LoongArch/mm: Align vmemmap to maximal folio size, specifically pointing out that it doesn't work for ARM due to undefined behavior in calculating order from len and suggested using ilog2(len / sizeof(struct page)) instead.

reviews.author: Vlastimil Babka
reviews.summary: Vlastimil Babka expressed concerns about the patch to make page_zonenum() use head page, specifically questioning whether shared tail pages per node+zone would be a problem.

reviews.author: Matthew Wilcox
reviews.summary: Matthew Wilcox questioned why the patch returns the zone number of the head page when the caller is asking for the zone number of the current page, suggesting a discussion on this in the commit message.
